metadata.title: CVE-2023-45863 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in lib/kobject.c in the Linux kernel before 6.2.3.With root access, an attacker can trigger a race condition that results ina fill_kobj_path out-of-bounds write.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-45863` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-250-generic - 4.4.0-250.284~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-250-generic - 4.4.0-250.284~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-250-lowlatency - 4.4.0-250.284~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1127-aws - 4.4.0-1127.133
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1173-azure - 4.15.0-1173.188~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-250.284~14.04.1').
linux-aws package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1127.133').
linux-azure package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1173.188~14.04.1').
